meanings.definition: The act of placing bookends on either side of a row of books to keep them upright.
meanings.sent1: I used bookending to organize my bookshelf neatly.
meanings.sent2: The bookending on the shelf kept all the books standing straight.
meanings.sent3: The bookending made the books look like soldiers standing in a row.
meanings.sent4: Her bookending of the novels created a symmetrical display.
meanings.sent5: The bookending added a touch of elegance to the book collection.

meanings.definition: The practice of using a similar phrase or element at the beginning and end of a piece of writing to create a sense of closure.
meanings.sent1: The author's bookending of the story with the same line was clever.
meanings.sent2: The bookending of the essay with a quote tied the whole piece together.
meanings.sent3: The bookending of the speech with a joke lightened the mood.
meanings.sent4: Her bookending of the poem with contrasting themes was impactful.
meanings.sent5: The bookending of the article with a question left readers pondering.

meanings.definition: The act of surrounding or enclosing something with bookends.
meanings.sent1: The bookending of the garden with statues created a beautiful entrance.
meanings.sent2: She completed the bookending of the flower bed with decorative rocks.
meanings.sent3: The bookending of the driveway with lights guided visitors to the house.
meanings.sent4: His bookending of the patio with plants gave it a cozy feel.
meanings.sent5: The bookending of the room with curtains added a touch of privacy.
